bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Frowde & Hodder & Stoughton, December 28, 1921

div1.p: Carter inquires about the price of a book, "Practice of Medicine in the Tropics", that he purchased recently.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Frowde & Hodder & Stoughton, December 28, 1921
div1.opener:
/LC
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON, D. C., U. S. A.,
December 28, 1921.
Henry Frowde and Hodder and Stoughton,
The Lancet Building, 1 & 2 Bedford Street,
Sondon, W. C. 2, England.
COMMITTEE OF
9 JAN 1922
FROWDE & HODDER & S PUSHTON
Gentlemen:
div1.p:
I am enclosing P. O. order for £ 1, 16s., 6d.,
as per enclosed bill, (Exhibit A),
In regard to this matter I would say

(1) That on October 23/21, I received a letter from you
dated September 19/21 (Exhibit B), enclosing a prospectus of “The
Practice of Medicine in the Tropics,” offering me, as a contributor,
the work at half the published price and asking if you might re-
serve a set for me. I notified you the same day, Oct. 23/21, to
reserve a set for me. The last page of this prospectus, Page XIX,
was lacking--torn off--(see my letter of Oct. 23rd.). I presume,
however, that my request of that date to reserve a set for me made
me an advance subscriber. Certainly I answered on the date of the
receipt of the first notice of publication.

(2) On November 22/21, I received another prospectus and a
circular letter (Exhibit C), stating that the price to advance sub-
scribers was £9, 9s. and that after publication it would be raised
to £12, 12s. This prospectus was intact and I filled out Page XIX
and carried it to Brentano--the largest retail booksellers in the
U. S. They declined to undertake to fill the order so I purchased
a P. O. Order for £ 4, 14s.. 6d--one half of the price to advance
2
advance
subscribers. The amount of the postage I did not know.

It did not seem necessary to enclose Page XIX to you, because
of my letter of Oct. 23/21. It is enclosed herewith (Exhibit D) as filled out for Brentano.

It seems to me that I am truly an "advance subscriber: that my
letter of Oct. 23/21 makes me one. My not sending the “Advance Sub-
scription Form” on that date was due to no error of my own, but to
the fact that it, Page XIX, was lacking from the prospectus sent me
under date of Sept. 19/21.

Unless then a contributor cannot be an advance subscriber, I
will ask you to take the five shillings postage from the enclosed
P. O. Order and return me the remainder. Otherwise, naturally, the
entire order is due you. Please answer this.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, H. R. Carter 5 enclosures.
Address
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
2121 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C., U. S. A.
